channel.title: Golang on ShootBird
channel.description: Recent content in Golang on ShootBird

item.title: I ❤️ Go: Types and Structs
item.description: Table of Contents 1. Why types are important 2. Custom Types 3. Structs 4. Going deeper 5. Postscript I’d like to take a moment here and talk about how much I love Go’s type system, and more importantly, how Go’s struct type has changed my life. 1. Why types are important Go is a statically-typed language. This means that you have to define the data type of each variable you use in your code.

item.title: Getting Stuff Out of a Todo App Like Clear
item.description: Table of Contents 1. What’s Clear? 2. Explaining SQLite 3. Why write a program to get the data out? 4. Getting started 5. Checking your .sqlite file 6. Writing your Go program 6.1. Connect to the SQLite database 6.2. Get column headings from a table 6.3. Get column data types 6.4. Read data from the database 7. Postscript and the Why Figure 1. Clear app. One frustration I’ve had with task list applications on iOS and macOS is that they tend to hide where they store the data you’ve saved on it.
